translated: As It Was Said
The One Hundred and One Groups
The Third Section
For Both Kinds of Benefit

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One, so I have heard:

original: “Ekadhammo, bhikkhave, bhāvito bahulīkato ubho atthe samadhigayha tiṭṭhati—
analyzed: eka dhammaḥ bhikkhave bhāvitaḥ bahulīkataḥ ubho atthe samadhigayha tiṭṭhati
translated: “Monks, there is one thing that, when developed and cultivated, leads to both kinds of benefit —

analyzed: diṭṭhadhammikam ca iva attham samparāyikam ca
translated: benefit here and now and benefit in the future.
What is that one thing?
It is diligence in skillful qualities.

original: Ayaṁ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhammo bhāvito bahulīkato ubho atthe samadhigayha tiṭṭhati—
analyzed: ayam kho bhikkhave eka dhammaḥ bhāvitaḥ bahulīkataḥ ubho atthe samadhigayha tiṭṭhati
translated: This is that one thing that, when developed and cultivated, leads to both kinds of benefit —

analyzed: diṭṭhadhammikam ca iva attham samparāyikam ca ati  etam attham bhagavān avoca
translated: benefit here and now and benefit in the future.”🔽The Blessed One said this.
And in connection with this, it was said:
“The wise praise diligence,

analyzed: puñña kiriyāsu paṇḍitā  appamattaḥ ubho atthe
translated: in the performance of meritorious deeds.🔽The wise one, diligent,
attains both kinds of benefit.
The benefit that is in the seen world
and the benefit that is in the future life.
The wise one, having attained the benefit,

original: paṇḍitoti pavuccatī”ti.🔽Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: paṇḍitaḥ iti pavuccati iti  ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: is called wise.”
This is the meaning of what the Blessed One said. So it was heard by me.🔽The third section is concluded.
